channel.title: [Help] Skills On Server [Help]
channel.description: Im currently using an IHybrid Source, ( also knowns as Exion, Project Insanity .. ect ) and i have a big problem with my skills. Let's say i start mining, the mining emote starts, but never stops, i can tele to home, and ill still be mining rocks.. anyway to fix? (( ALL MY SKILLS DO THIS )).

item.title: [Help] Skills On Server [Help]
item.dc:creator: @I_Cam_I I Cam I
item.description:
@I_Cam_I wrote:

Not really :), you should add what he said if you dont already have it added.

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Skills On Server [Help]
item.dc:creator: @harlan102 harlan102
item.description:
@harlan102 wrote:

Hey, very easy fix takes like 5 seconds.

[quote]Alright so I have seen numerous help threads on how to fix this, and I hope by creating this will help cut them down and help people out.

Alright so navigate to
Code:
src > server > model > players > packets
and open up Walking.java

Now search for
Code:
c.getPA().removeAllWindows();
Under that add
Code:
c.startAnimation(65535);
So it should look like this now
Code:
c.fishing = false;
if(!c.isBanking && !c.inTrade) {
c.getPA().removeAllWindows();
c.startAnimation(65535);
}
Save and compile and that’s it![quote]

Copypastied from Karnage off of runeserver.

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Skills On Server [Help]
item.dc:creator: @Code_kai Code kai
item.description:
@Code_kai wrote:

heres my mining under skills

[code]package server.model.players.skills;

import server.model.players.*;
import server.Config;
import server.util.Misc;

/**

  • @Author Sanity
    */

public class Mining {

Client c;

private final int VALID_PICK[] = {1265,1267,1269,1273,1271,1275};
private final int[] PICK_REQS = {1,1,6,6,21,31,41,61};
private final int[] RANDOM_GEMS = {1623,1621,1619,1617,1631};
private int oreType;
private int exp;
private int levelReq;
private int pickType;
private final int EMOTE = 625;

public Mining(Client c) {
	this.c = c;
}

public void startMining(int oreType, int levelReq, int exp) {
	c.turnPlayerTo(c.objectX, c.objectY);
	if (goodPick() > 0) {
		if (c.playerLevel[c.playerMining] >= levelReq) {
			this.oreType = oreType;
			this.exp = exp;
			this.levelReq = levelReq;
			this.pickType = goodPick();
			c.sendMessage("You swing your pick at the rock.");
			c.miningTimer = getMiningTimer(oreType);
			c.startAnimation(EMOTE);
		} else {
			resetMining();
			c.sendMessage("You need a mining level of " + levelReq + " to mine this rock.");
			c.startAnimation(65535);
		}		
	} else {
		resetMining();
		c.sendMessage("You need a pickaxe to mine this rock.");
		c.startAnimation(65535);
		c.getPA().resetVariables();
	}
}

public void mineOre() {
	if (c.getItems().addItem(oreType,1)) {
		c.startAnimation(EMOTE);
		c.sendMessage("You manage to mine some ore.");
		c.getPA().addSkillXP(exp * Config.MINING_EXPERIENCE, c.playerMining);
		c.getPA().refreshSkill(c.playerMining);
		c.miningTimer = getMiningTimer(oreType);
		if (Misc.random(25) == 10) {
			c.getItems().addItem(RANDOM_GEMS[(int)(RANDOM_GEMS.length * Math.random())], 1);
			c.sendMessage("You find a gem!");
		}
	} else {
		c.getPA().resetVariables();
		c.startAnimation(65535);
	}
}

public void resetMining() {
	this.oreType = -1;
	this.exp = -1;
	this.levelReq = -1;
	this.pickType = -1;
}

public int goodPick() {
	for (int j = VALID_PICK.length - 1; j >= 0; j--) {
		if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == VALID_PICK[j]) {
			if (c.playerLevel[c.playerMining] >= PICK_REQS[j])
				return VALID_PICK[j];
		}		
	}
	for (int i = 0; i < c.playerItems.length; i++) {
		for (int j = VALID_PICK.length - 1; j >= 0; j--) {
			if (c.playerItems[i] == VALID_PICK[j] + 1) {
				if (c.playerLevel[c.playerMining] >= PICK_REQS[j])
					return VALID_PICK[j];
			}
		}		
	}
	return - 1;
}

public int getMiningTimer(int ore) {
	int time = Misc.random(5);
	if (ore == 451) {
		time += 4;
	}
	return time;
}

}
[/code]

Read full topic
